titleStmt.title: Jeremiah T. Boyle to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG14237

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 1

body.p:
Louisville, Ky., 23d Aug 1864.
Gov Thos E Bramlette
Executive Office
Frankfort Ky
Dear Governor

Knowing as I do your opinion that Kentuckians ought to command Kentuckians, I write to say that Capt Slater of 11th Ky Cavalry promoted to Major in that Regiment is an Indianean and not a Kentuckian -- Capt Mangan, of this city, of the 11th Ky Cavalry is one of the best officers in the service. Col Adams who commanded the Brigade regards him as equal to any man known to him for coolness, courage & Will. I verily believe the Commission to the Indianean should be revoked and Mangan appointed. I am so averse to see men of other states command our troops that I am induced to write you on subject There is no doubt we have plenty of
competent men to command our own regiments.

Hartily & Truly
Yr Friend
J. T. Boyle

Stating that Capt. Slater of 11th Ky. Cav. recently made Maj. same Reg't. is an Indianian. Thinks Kentuckians should command Kentuckians. Recommends Capt. Mangan, 11th Ky. Cav'y as a No. 1. officer and one in every way worthy of the Majority. Thinks Slater's comn should be revoked and Mangam comnd in his stead.
